title: Islanders transporting bullock to ship
creator: National Library of Ireland
description: Islanders on Inisheer bringing a bullock out to Dublin built steamer, the Dún Aengus, on 31 May 1939 for transport to Galway. This is how livestock had to be transported from the island between 1921 and 1958 until a pier was built on Inisheer (Inis Oírr) in 1997.

title: O'Brien's Castle and Signal Tower
creator: Strong, Harold
description: O'Brien's Castle and Signal Tower, Inisheer, Aran Islands O'Brien's Castle was probably built in the 14th century. The castle was taken from the O'Briens by the O'Flaherty's of Connemara in 1582. It was occupied by them and others until 1652, when the Aran Islands were surrendered to Cromwellian forces. The military signal tower, which was built between 1804 and 1806 was part of a network of towers built around the Irish coast.

title: Rescue Unit on Inisheer, Aran Islands
creator: Strong, Harold
description: On the Move, Inisheer, Aran Islands. The onshore rescue unit on the move to practice their skills.

title: Tarring a Curragh
creator: Strong, Harold
description: arring a Curragh, Inisheer, Aran Islands. Applying tar (bitumen) to the boats canvas covering

title: Carrying a curragh to the sea
creator: Strong, Harold

title: Winter fulel for the islands brough ashore
creator: Strong, Harold
description: Winter Fuel, Inisheer, Aran Islands There is no source of fuel on the island. Here the winter fuel, turf (peat), is brought from the mainland by the traditional Galway Bay Hookers as was done for generations.
